intro: Audibertia capitata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Audibertia capitata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
